Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  mickel.anim.Sprite
      Controller

public class Controller
extends Sprite

Represents a single, GUI-based controller for a color channel. It includes a palette showing the current channel color, a numeric display of the current color channel value, and buttons for increasing and/or decreasing the channel's value.

Controller

public Controller(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  RGBA c)
Initializes the properties of this color channel.

Parameters:
x - Upper left corner of the channel
y - Upper left corner of the channel
width - Overall width of the channel
c - Which channel this is (R, G, B, or A)

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor()
postcondition: Returns the Color object that corresponds to the current color value of this particular channel. For example, the RED channel will return: new Color(myColorValue, 0, 0, 255)

getColorValue

public int getColorValue()
postcondition: Returns the numerical value of this color channel.

isOverLeftButton

private boolean isOverLeftButton(int x,
                                 int y)
precondition: x and y are coordinates of a point in the Stage window. postcondition: Returns true if point (x, y) is located within the bounds of the "left" button for this color channel controller and returns false if point (x, y) is not within the bounds. The "left" button is centered on the point myLeftButton and has a diameter of myButtonSize.

isOverRightButton

private boolean isOverRightButton(int x,
                                  int y)
precondition: x and y are coordinates of a point in the Stage window. postcondition: Returns true if point (x, y) is located within the bounds of the "right" button for this color channel controller and returns false if point (x, y) is not within the bounds. The "right" button is centered on the point myRightButton and has a diameter of myButtonSize.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(mickel.io.Key k)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user pressing a key on the keyboard. A "key press" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc.

Overrides:
keyPressed in class Sprite
Parameters:
k - The pressed Key

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(mickel.io.Key k)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a key on the keyboard. A "key release" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc.

Overrides:
keyReleased in class Sprite
Parameters:
k - The released Key

keyTyped

public void keyTyped(mickel.io.Key k)
The following methods are event-handling methods, similar to the mouseClicked() above except that they respond to keyboard events and other types of mouse events. You may wish to experiment with these to add additional "user controls" to your application.

Overrides:
keyTyped in class Sprite
Parameters:
k - The typed Key

mouseClicked

public void mouseClicked(int x,
                         int y)
precondition: x and y are coordinates of a point in the Stage window where the mouse was clicked. postcondition: If point (x, y) is over the "left" button, the value of myColorValue should be decreased by STEP. If it is over the "right" button, the value of myColorValue should be increased by STEP. NOTE: The value of myColorValue should not exceed the range of valid color values (i.e., 0 through 255).

Overrides:
mouseClicked in class Sprite
Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(int x,
                         int y)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse between the time that a "mouse press" and a "mouse release" occurs. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location after the movement has occurred.

Overrides:
mouseDragged in class Sprite
Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(int x,
                          int y)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "release" equates to the second half of a "click" event.

Overrides:
mouseReleased in class Sprite
